2.2.5. Lab – Responses¶

In this section, you will define the virtual server IP address its SSL profile settings

2.2.5.1. Task – Create a Client SSL Profile¶

  1. Navigate to Local Traffic>>Profiles>>SSL>>Client, then click the + symbol to create a new SSL Profile

  1. Enter the name CLIENT_CERTSSO
  2. Check Custom box to the right of Certificate Key Chain
  3. Click add

  1. Select acme.com-wildcard from the certificate dropdown box
  2. Select acme.com-wildcard from the key dropdown box
  3. Click Add

  1. Check the custom box to the right of Client Certificate Constrained Delegation
  2. Select Enabled from the Client Certificate Constrained Delegation Dropdown box

Click Finished

2.2.5.2. Task – Create a Server SSL Profile¶

  1. Click Show Advanced Setting located in the top right corner to expose the server-side SSL profile settings

  1. Enter SERVER_CERTSSO for profile name
  2. Check the two custom boxes next to Certificate and Key
  3. Select default.crt from the certificate dropbox box
  4. Select default.key from the key dropdown box

  1. Check the three custom boxes next to Client Certificate Constrained Delegation, CA Certificate, and CA Key
  2. Select Enabled from the Client Certificate Constrained Delegation Dropdown Box
  3. Select f5lab.local-wildcard from the CA Certificate dropdown box
  4. Select f5lab.local-wildcard from the CA Key dropdown box
  5. Click Finished
